head.title: Electric Flow integration with CICS CM

div.p: This plugin integrates Commander with the CICS Configuration Manager (CM) tool for administering resource definitions in the CICS application server. It provides access to all CICS CM operations via the CICS CM SOAP API.

ul.h2: The EC-CICS-CM Procedures and What They Are Used For
ul.p: For a CICS CM perspective, see https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/en/SS2L7A_5.3.0/com.ibm.cics.cm.doc/ccv-api-summary.html
Here are the EC-CICS-CM procedures, grouped according to their purpose:

li.p: Manipulating objects and their data:
Create* Create a resource definition (CreateInOther) or a CICS Configuration Manager repository object (CreateInRepository).
Update* Modify a resource definition (UpdateInOther) or a CICS Configuration Manager repository object (UpdateInRepository).
Copy Copy resource definitions between groups or CICS configurations.
Delete* Delete resource definitions (DeleteFromOther) or CICS Configuration Manager repository objects (DeleteFromRepository).
Alter Alter selected attribute values across one or more resource definitions, without affecting other attribute values.
Rename* Rename resource definitions, and optionally move them to another group (RenameResDef, or RenameFromGroup to rename/move the contents of a resource group).
Associating objects with other objects:
Add* Add objects to a container object, such as a change package (AddResDefToChgPkg, or AddCmdToChgPkg to add a command), to a resource group (AddToResGrp), or to a list (AddToResDesc).

Remove* Remove objects from a container object, such as a change package (RemoveResDefFromChgPkg, or RemoveCmdToChgPkg to remove a command), from a resource group (RemoveFromResGrp), or list (RemoveFromResDesc).
Retrieving object information:

Inquire* Return all the fields for a single resource definition (InquireInOther), CICS Configuration Manager repository object (InquireInRepository), or CICS Configuration Manager journal object (InquireInJournal).

List* Return selected fields from one or more resource definitions (ListFromOther, or ListWithinResults to filter the results), CICS Configuration Manager repository objects (ListFromRepository), or CICS Configuration Manager journal objects (ListFromJournal).
Packaging changes to resource definitions:
Ready Indicate that the resource definitions in a change package are ready for migration.
Unready Indicate that the resource definitions in a change package are no longer ready for migration.
Approve Add to a change package the approval of a particular approver role.
Disapprove Remove from a change package the approval of a particular approver role.

Migrate Copy the resource definitions in a change package from source to target CICS configurations, and invoke commands in the change package on target CICS configurations, according to the specified migration scheme.
Backout Back out a previous change package migration.
Altering in-memory images of resource definitions in active CICS regions:
Discard* Discard the in-memory image of resource definitions from active CICS regions (DiscardChgPkg, or DiscardAdHoc for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).
Install* Dynamically make resource definitions available to an active CICS region (InstallChgPkg, or InstallAdHoc for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).

Newcopy* Reload in-memory copies of resource definitions associated with a CICS program definition or document template definition (NewcopyChgPkg, or NewcopyAdHoc for arbitrary resource definitions not from a change package).
Importing resource definitions from an export file:

Import Import resource definitions from an export file received from another CICS Configuration Manager system. Optionally, if the export file contains change package details, also registers change packages in the importing CICS Configuration Manager repository.
Recovering historical versions of resource definitions from the journal:
Recover Recovers before or after images of historical resource definitions from the journal.

div.p: Plugin configurations are sets of parameters that apply across some or all of the plugin procedures. They reduce repetition of common values, create predefined parameter sets for end users, and securely store credentials where needed. Each configuration is given a unique name that is entered in designated parameters on procedures that use them.
To create plugin configurations in ElectricFlow, do these steps:

ol.li: Go to Administration > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Click Configure to open the @PLUGIN_KEY@ Configurations page.
To enable ElectricFlow server to communicate with the API, enter the following information:

tr.td: Unique name for the plugin configuration.
The URL of the SOAP interface of the CICS CM server to connect to (this should normally be of the format http://[server]:[port]/CICS/CWBA/CCVWSDSH/CCVADISP ).
The CICS CM version number (normally the same as the CICS version number).
The name of the connection from the CSD to a specific CICS region.

div.p: The @PLUGIN_KEY@ Configurations page now shows the new configuration.
To edit plugin configurations in ElectricFlow, do these steps:

ol.li: Go to Administration > Plugins to open the Plugin Manager.
Click Configure to open the Configurations page.
Find the configuration that you want to edit.
Edit the parameters in the configuration.
Click OK to save the modified configuration.

div.p: Back out a previous change package migration.

tr.td: The property that results will be returned into.
The change package ID of the change to back out.
The migration scheme of the change to back out.

The eventID of the execution of the Migrate command for the specified change package and migration scheme to back out (if omitted, it defaults to the most recent Migrate command for that change package and migration scheme).
